intro: Rungia paucinervia, commonly known as the slender rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
